article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: Fighting  in  Gaza  continued  alongside  the  plan's  publication,  with  dozens  of  people  killed  in  the  previous  24  hours,  the  Hamas-run  health  ministry  said.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: It  said  it  had  conducted  strikes  on  "terrorist  infrastructure"  and  had  killed  people  who  it  described  as  militants,  who  it  said  had  tried  to  detonate  an  explosive  next  to  soldiers.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: It  also  announced  that  it  had  killed  a  senior  Palestinian  Islamic  Jihad  operative,  Mamdouh  Lolo,  in  an  air  strike.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: The  Hamas-run  health  ministry  in  Gaza  said  125  people  had  been  killed  in  the  past  24  hours  across  the  Strip.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: A  health  ministry  official  said  14  people  -  including  nine  children  -  were  killed  by  Israeli  air  strikes  in  al-Mawasi,  to  the  west  of  Khan  Younis.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: The  total  number  of  people  killed  in  Gaza  since  the  start  of  Israel's  retaliatory  campaign  had  reached  more  than  22,400  by  Thursday  -  comprising  almost  1%  of  the  enclave's  2.3  million  population,  the  Hamas-run  health  ministry  said.

article_title: Israeli minister outlines plans for Gaza after war
sentence: Israel's  offensive  started  after  Hamas  gunmen  launched  a  surprise  attack  on  southern  Israel  on  7  October,  killing  1,200  people,  most  of  them  civilians,  and  taking  about  240  people  hostage.
